reviewText: I am a huge fan of this show and I'm so excited for the 5th season part 1 to come out on dvd! I've watched every episode like a 1,000 times or more. It's filled with so much drama. To Heidi showing up to Lauren's birthday party or Spencer punching Camren in the face to Lauren actually showing up for Heidi and Spencer's wedding. Part 2 of the 5th season starts on the 29th with my girl Kristin Cavallari and I couldn't be more excited for her to stir things up over in The Hills if you haven't seen the trailor for the new season you need to watch it ASAP!!!!! Can't wait for it to come out!

reviewText: The Hills, Season Five Part One, continues on with the never-ending (but always entertaining!) drama that the show is famous for.  While this season is the last for cast member LC (aka Lauren Conrad), whom the show is normally centered around, this season actually mostly focuses on Spencer and Heidi, while LC pretty much fades into the background for the majority of it.  The season starts off with just as much drama as ever, when Stephanie Pratt brings Heidi to LC's birthday party uninvited, creating some tension.  Spencer is less than thrilled that Heidi is hanging out with his sworn enemy, so he goes out to a bar for a "guys night", and ends up flirting with a bartender named stacey.  When Heidi finds out about Spencer's flirting (At LC's party) she dramatically demands that she wants to get off the yacht that the party is being held on, and is surprisingly comforted by her old friend LC.  The two girls have a teary talk, leaving Heidi hopeful for a renewal for their friendship at last, but LC is less than enthusiastic about that idea, and is angry at Stephanie for continually trying to force her and Heidi to reconcile.  Throughout the rest of the season, Spencer and Heidi battle over Spencer's flirtation with stacey, and end up in couple's counseling, in order to try and save their relationship; LC gets Stephanie a job at People's Revolution, which she ends up regretting; Audrina tells Justin Bobby that she's done with him for good (right), and turns to Brody Jenner for comfort during a vacation in Hawaii, which causes problems when Brody's girlfriend Jayde Nicole finds out.  The season ends with Spencer making a call to a very unexpected person to apologize, in order to get her to attend his wedding to Heidi.  Heidi ends up getting her dream wedding to Spencer, and the wedding day is full of surprises (but not really) when two unexpected guests show up- One who shows up to rattle things up among the cast members, and one who shows up for a short time before disappearing into a limo as soon as the wedding is over.If you like the other seasons of The Hills, definitely add this one to your collection!
